The primary role of the Senior Advisor of Data Strategy (SADS) is insuring the Agency has the right data usable in the right ways to fulfill its mission. The SADS's role is part data strategist and advisor, part steward for improving data quality, part evangelist for data sharing/integration, part technologist, and part designer and developer of new data products. The SADS performs or supervises, but not limited to the following duties:  Address the enterprise's ever-growing data assets and needs toward the end of reducing cost and increasing value. This includes, but not limited to: Conduct Zero-Based reviews of all data collections  Maintain a central inventory of the Agency's data collections and datasets  Standardize and automate all future data collections  Lead data-driven program(s) to leverage data for actionable intelligence creating operational effectiveness and critical new ways to look at and improve business processes  Implement a broad range of process automation and embedded analytical solutions that enable wide adoption of data-driven capabilities  Serve as the agency's executive business lead, ensuring that enterprise data is available, reliable, consistent, accessible, secure, and timely to support the mission and activities of the agency. This includes, but not limited to: Support developing data driven performance management opportunities for the agency  Enable mining of the data for new features  Ensure data privacy and security policies are developed in balance with self-service and governance models for equally achieving business objectives while protecting data assets  Ensure data is being developed as a viable resource for current and future needs both inside and outside of specific IT systems. This includes, but not limited to: Work with the CIO to develop data management policies and practices to support the mission of the agency.  Overseeing the budget and mechanism for managing the data procurement and licensing.  Develop ways to effectively track the outcomes of decisions influenced by data and analytics  Responsible for data reform and modernization-how the agency collects, uses, manages, and shares data-toward the goal of "fact-based, data-driven decision-making." This includes, but not limited to: Ensure data supports specific policy-related activities.  Work with stakeholders to plan future data needs  Coordinate annual or bi-annual data reviews of the agency data   Requirements  Conditions of Employment  You must be a U.S. Citizen or a National.  Required to pass a background investigation and fingerprint check.  Must be registered for Selective Service, if applicable (www.sss.gov).  Submit a Financial Disclosure Report (OGE-278) upon appointment.  You must use the questionnaire text boxes when submitting narrative responses to the PTQs (10,000 character limit each)  Your resume and question responses must demonstrate the job-related competencies.  If selected, you will be required to serve a one-year probationary period.  Qualifications  8+ years of proven leadership roles and skills related to Emerging Technology, such as but not limited to Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Data Virtualization, Data Fabrics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Robotic Process Automation implementation with professional experience in applied implementation of Robotic Process Automation, Analytics and Modeling, Machine Learning Methods, Data Architecture and Management, and Data Visualization.  Proven experience working with product teams to architect systems that enable data management, governance, security in proven ways to facilitate data-driven decision making.  Ability to lead in fast paced and dynamic environment.  Excellent Communication and presentation skills.  Proven public sector and/or corporate experience leadership with major data analytics, data governance, and data management initiatives that resulted in measurable improvements with a sound, applied current and emerging Technology strategies aligned with an overall (digital) business strategy.  Technically oriented and personally proactive with extreme attention to detail.  Ability to work effectively on independent projects as well as within team environment.  Strong written and verbal communication skills are a must.   To meet the minimum requirements for this position, candidates must demonstrate their experience in their narrative responses to the Specialized Experience and Professional Technical Qualifications. In addition, all responses supported within the resume.  Experience must have been at a sufficiently high level of difficulty to clearly show that the candidate possesses the required professional/technical qualifications set forth below.  Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.  Professional Technical Qualifications: Applicants must clearly demonstrate in their application materials that they possess technical attributes in the Professional/Technical Qualifications (PTQs).  Applicants are required to input narrative responses to the Professional Technical Qualifications (PTQs) in the text boxes as prompted by USAJobs.  Each PTQ have a 10,000-character limit (to include spaces) and must be adhered to.   The Professional Technical Qualifications (PTQs) for this position are:  Demonstrate your ability to plan and execute high level programs and/or projects that are highly specialized and impact the agency or organizational level. This includes setting vision and strategy, making decisions and influencing others, having a direct and major impact on the quality of the program or project results.  Demonstrate senior level experience communicating and driving large, cross-functional data management programs involving coordination with multiple stakeholders at various levels of the organization.  Demonstrate senior level experience defining and articulating enterprise data management, strategic vision and translating it into implementable steps. Describe your experience using various technologies of data management within an organization.  Describe your experience working with product teams to support and enable citizen data science and self-service analytics.  Education  There is no education requirement for this position.  Strongly preferred educational level is PhD and/or Masters and a minimum educational requirement for this position is bachelors in Emerging Technology fields such as Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or other technical related field. Additional information  Probationary Period:  You will be required to serve a one-year probationary period.  If you are a male applicant born after December 31, 1959, you must certify that you have registered with the Selective Service System. If you are exempt from registration under Selective Service Law, you must provide appropriate proof of exemption. Please visit the Selective Service System website for more information.   This is a Non-Bargaining Unit position.  This is a Public Trust position and has a risk level designation of low risk.  The incumbent may be required to submit to a drug test to screen for illegal drug use prior to appointment and, if appointed, the incumbent may be subjected to random drug testing procedures.   Background Investigation:  If selected for this position, you may be required to complete a Declaration for Federal Employment (OF-306), which includes a fingerprint and credit check, to determine your suitability for Federal employment and to authorize a background investigation.  The USPTO participates in E-Verify. For more information on E-Verify, please visit http://www.dhs.gov/files/programs/gc_1185221678150.shtm  All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choice.  More than one selection may be made from this announcement if additional identical vacancies in the same title, series, grade, and unit occur within 90 days from the date the certificate was issued.  The Ethics in Government Act of 1978, as amended, requires senior officials in the executive, legislative and judicial branches to file public reports of their finances as well as other interests outside the Government. If selected for this position you will be required to file a Financial Disclosure Report (OGE Form 278). The OGE 278 is available to the public. The primary purpose of disclosure is to assist agencies in identifying potential conflicts of interest between a filer's official duties and the filer's private financial interests and affiliations. As a Senior Analytic Methodologist, you will assist and support the analyst workforce in developing coherent analytic strategies to resolve key intelligence questions. You will provide support to exploitation, intelligence analysis, and product development to include statistical and trend analysis, data manipulation and format conversion, data collection / querying from TCPED systems, data formatting for visualization and presentation, and database design and data entry form development Interact with analysts, mission partners and others on analytical functionality and exploitation and related support tools. Support the assessment of new analytical tools and the necessary standards to facilitate compatibility and greater efficiencies across the tools sets utilized by imagery/geospatial analysts. Work with very little guidance and be fully capable of delivering all analytic methodology support required with little direction. Provide direction to lower level employees and perform quality control and quality assurance checks on other employees' work. Provide advice to government leadership on processes, procedures, technology, and items of interest. Lead collaboration in the performance of services. Such collaboration efforts should lead to better synergized analysis than the sum of the individual parts. Supervise, provide guidance and direct workflow of lower level employees. Apply mathematical techniques to solve complex problems and develop quantitative based assessments. Apply scientifically based approaches to help solve complex problems and issues to include: statistical data analysis, knowledge discovery, and mathematical modeling. Provide database consultation, graphical data visualizations, and recommendations for quantitative data selection and collection. Work rapidly in a high tempo, high stress environment that often requires multi-tasking  Required Education, Experience, & Skills  At least 10 years relevant experience. Minimum of a bachelor’s statistics, applied mathematics or a related field. Demonstrated relevant experience in conducting analysis or providing analytical support to government clients Demonstrated relevant experience identifying, retrieving, manipulating, relating and/or exploiting multiple structured data sets from various sources. Demonstrated relevant experience in understanding of statistical/mathematical analysis in order to apply statistical/mathematical techniques to GEOINT Attended a basic Intelligence Course Demonstrated relevant experience with analytic methodologies in support of intelligence production. Familiarity with knowledge of GEOINT operations and sensors, which can be applied to satisfy key intelligence questions. Demonstrated experience building/maintaining a database or spreadsheet, performing quality checks and data integrity reviews, developing statistical analysis and visualizations, and explaining and briefing results to technical and non-technical audiences and policy makers.  Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills  Demonstrated relevant programming experience using R within the past 3 years Demonstrated relevant programming experience using Python within the past 3 years Demonstrated relevant programming experience using VBA within the past 3 years Demonstrated relevant experience using ESRI ArcGIS within the past 3 years Demonstrated relevant experience using Tableau within the past 3 years Demonstrated relevant experience building and maintaining databases and complex data entry forms within the past 3 years.  About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.  Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.  At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We’re laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also enjoy work-life balance, uncover new experiences, and collaborate with passionate colleagues.

IronBrick established more than a decade ago with the vision to reduce the cost, risk, and effort of managing information. Today that vision is still strong, our innovative services and solutions transform IT environments by solving customer’s complex technology and business challenges.  IronBrick demonstrates value by focusing on the highest priorities of our customers for IT modernization, from the data center to the cloud and from security to big data & analytics. Our list of federal and enterprise customers spans the globe, and we deliver results by leveraging long-standing partnerships with leading technology companies coupled with our high performing service practice.   ***MUST BE A US CITIZEN AND HOLD A MINIMUM CURRENT TS/SCI FULLSCOPE U.S. GOVERNMENT SECURITY CLEARANCE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION***  Seeking a candidate for a rewarding and exciting position as a  Data   Scientist/Engineer , working with a team of developers, technology professionals, tradecraft experts, and tactical developers to solve difficult problems and create solutions needed to meet mission needs. Working with this team will require unique expertise and the ability to articulate problems, requirements, and proposed solutions while working with both technical and non-technical resources to achieve goals in support of various mission sets. Key Responsibilities: Job duties for the include the following: Design, develop, code, test, and debug complex new software products, or make significant enhancements to existing software Participate in building scalable platforms that incorporate business intelligence, analytics, data science, and data management Use firsthand technical expertise in a variety of large data technologies, social media applications, and mobile technology in order to fashion capabilities to monitor, collect, and analyze data that may be generated from these types of technologies Understand data flow, and determine how to develop test and automation suites to ensure data collection Provide ongoing maintenance, support, and enhancements in existing systems and platforms Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, analysts, project managers, and other engineers Utilize data science disciplines and techniques needed to deliver, create, and maintain the collection and other types of platforms. Troubleshoot complex problems and provides customer support for software systems and application issues Deliver on multiple competing priorities once initial input has been received Maintain and enhance operations security and be sensitive to mission needs regarding discoverability and attribution Requirements 8-10 years of experience, or BS in Computer Science plus 6-8 years of experience, or MS plus 5-6 years of experience Experience with various cloud providers (Amazon, Azure, etc.) and components of those providers such as Amazon’s Lambda, EC2, Glacier, or EBS functionality Expertise with a variety of database technologies and capabilities such as NoSQL, SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Oracle, Ganglia, Expertise with programming languages and frameworks such as .NET, Java, Python, and Bash scripting Familiarity with tools like Jenkins, Team City, Selenium, Chef, Puppet, Ansible Why Work for IronBrick: Our people are our greatest assets. We offer exciting and challenging career opportunities with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package that includes the following: Employer subsidized medical, dental and vision coverage; Employer-paid life insurance, short-term and long-term disability; Employer matching 401(K) with immediate vesting; Highly competitive PTO allowance and holidays; Maternity leave and Paternity leave; Tuition Reimbursement Program. To learn more visit us at IronBrick. IronBrick Associates, LLC reserves the right to deny access and participation to any third-party employer.

Overview: BigBear.ai, is seeking a  Machine Learning Engineer  to be responsible for a wide range of data management functions in support of BigBear.ai’s advanced ML tools. The successful candidate will support and work within an ML product implementation team supporting a fast-paced, first-of-kind, multi-year predictive analytics initiative in support of an expanding number of government clients. Ability to perform various development activities with little oversight and to quickly learn to use a broad complement of data management tools is critical. This is an ideal opportunity to be part of one of the fastest growing AI/ML companies in the industry. At BigBear.ai, we're in this business together. We own it, we make it thrive, and we enjoy the challenges of our work. We know that our employees play the largest role in our continual success. That is why we foster an environment of growth and development, with an emphasis on opportunity, recognition, and work-life balance. We give the same high level of commitment to our employees that we give to our clients. If BigBear.ai sounds like the place where you want to be, we'd enjoy speaking with you. This position can be located in McLean, VA; or possibly remote. What you will do: Rapidly develop custom dataset ingestion workflows using a combination of Python, Java, SQL, and KNIME analytics platform Develop and troubleshoot ETL functions in Oracle Database, AWS, Linux, and KNIME Create schemas, data models, and custom feature engineering Create automated job flows and monitor daily database performance Provide development support to the Scrum Master in an agile software development environment Work as a key member of an AWS native solution software development team and work to identify risks and bottlenecks associated with big data environments What you need to have: 2+ years of experience in software development Demonstrated experience with the following: Development using Oracle 11g or higher PL/SQL programming expertise, SQL tuning, Packages, and Procedures development Unix Shell Scripting and Cron Job set up ETL development, job flow configuration, and monitoring tools (i.e. Informatica or Talend) AWS native solutions, including API Gateway, S3, EC2, Athena, and Lambda Understanding of feature engineering and data enrichment for predictive analytics applications What we'd like you to have: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field 4+ years of experience in ETL and database development 2+ years of Python experience Army subject matter expertise Experience with Data Lake concepts, terminology, and architecture Strong Java skills Experience with distributed processing Production implementaton experience Experience with containerization (e.g Docker, Kubernetes, etc.) About BigBear.ai: A leader in decision dominance for more than 20 years, BigBear.ai operationalizes artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale through its end-to-end data analytics platform. The Company uses its proprietary AI/ML technology to support its customers’ decision-making processes and deliver practical solutions that work in complex, realistic and imperfect data environments. BigBear.ai’s composable AI-powered platform solutions work together as often as they stand alone: Observe (data ingestion and conflation), Orient (composable machine learning at scale), and Dominate (visual anticipatory intelligence and optimization). BigBear.ai’s customers, which include the U.S. Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, the U.S. Federal Government, as well as customers in the commercial sector, rely on BigBear.ai’s high value software products and technology to analyze information, identify and manage risk, and support mission critical decision making. Headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, BigBear.ai has additional locations in Virginia, Massachusetts, Michigan, and California. BigBear.ai will request COVID-19 vaccination status information as part of the onboarding process.

At Torc, we have always believed that autonomous vehicle technology will transform how we travel, move freight, and do business.  A leader in autonomous driving since 2007, Torc has spent over a decade commercializing our solutions with experienced partners. Now a part of the Daimler family, we are focused solely on developing software for automated trucks to transform how the world moves freight.  Join us and catapult your career with the company that helped pioneer autonomous technology, and the first AV software company with the vision to partner directly with a truck manufacturer. You'll work with an experienced team of people who are committed to creating safer roads and saving lives, and your contributions will have an unequivocal impact on the future of trucking and autonomous technology.  What you'll do:  We are seeking a Machine Learning Software Engineer Co-Op to assist with the design, development, and maintenance of machine learning algorithms for our self-driving vehicles.  Assist with the design and implementation of the following:   End-to-end pipeline for annotation, training and deployment of machine learning algorithms services and dashboards for training progress and validation metrics  Crowdsourcing pipelines for collecting internal and external annotations  Participate in the design, development, evaluation, deployment and updating of data-driven models and analytical solutions for machine learning (ML) applications  Work with product owners and customers on understanding their learning applications, assisting with integration and providing ML expertise  Produce high quality code that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked in regularly for continuous integration  Conduct technical investigations and prototyping in a fast-paced environment  Strong communication skills, both written and oral   Candidate is expected to work 40 hours a week during the duration of their co-op.  What you'll need to succeed:   Candidate must be a full-time student currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field  0-2 years of machine learning experience  Previous software development experience  Experience in the following areas: Computer vision and machine learning  Image processing  Creating clean C++ code  Object-oriented design  Rapid development and prototyping in Python  GPU compute  Familiarity with at least one of the following, or similar platforms: MXNet, Caffe, TensorFlow, Keras, Torch, Dlib, scikit-learn

Description: The candidate will support a team that develops and manages data science programs and systems for data aggregation, data analytics, data summarization, and data visualization on structured and unstructured datasets. The team is supports the customer data science programs and systems in various facets: data architecture, data engineering, data science, data visualization, and documentation. TS SCI w/ Poly Required . Requirements: Required Skills: TS SCI w/ Poly Required 16+ years' of relevant technical experience required Strong Python development background experience with expertise in Python data analytics packages such as pandas, numpy, scipy, gensim, and scikit-learn Experience with database technologies, including Elasticsearch and SQL databases Experience with data pipelines and workflow technologies, such as Apache NiFi Experience with task tracking and version control technology, such as GitHub and JIRA Demonstrated artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies/packages, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn Practical experience with machine learning model development on text data and structured datasets Experience data visualization technologies and packages, such as Kibana, Bokeh, Leaflet/Folium, and Tableau Practical experience developing in a cloud environment, such as Amazon Web Services Desired Skills: Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field Professional experience with computer networks, digital forensics, or cybersecurity topics A current U.S. government security clearance and background investigation is required and therefore all candidates must be a U.S. Citizen

Founded in 2005 by supply chain risk management expert Jennifer Bisceglie, we have grown into the largest and most influential player in the emerging operational resilience space. This past July we achieved $100 million dollars in Series C funding led by the investment firm Night Dragon, with additional participation from Series A and B investors Kleiner Perkins and Venrock. This latest round of funding brings Interos' valuation to $1billion, earning us unicorn status.  Based in Arlington, Va., Interos' breakthrough SaaS platform leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to model the entire business ecosystems of companies into a living global map. Users can drill down to any single supplier, anywhere – helping businesses and government organizations reduce risk, avoid operational disruptions, and achieve dramatically superior resilience and performance. We have seen hypergrowth in the past 3 years and continue to expand our team across the US and several countries in Europe.  The Opportunity:  This position reports directly to the VP of Machine Learning and works on high-impact projects developing NLP-driven models for production environments with critical customer value. At the highest level, we find events in the news and public datasets that will impact supply chains and link them to individual suppliers. We have a wonderful foundation, but you will come in and accelerate that growth fivefold.   You want to make an oversized impact on a unicorn startup by leveraging your experience and skillset to push the boundaries of ML and NLP at scale.  You are currently an L6+ Staff/Principal/Fellow Machine Learning Engineer.  You have at least 10, preferably 15+ years of professional experience with a strong emphasis on Machine Learning.  You have worked for a Fortune 500 company well known for its ML prowess (e.g., Facebook, Apple, Amazon, Netflix, Google), and you understand ML at scale.  You have multiple examples of successful NLP-focused projects where you personally led the implementation.  Your work has almost certainly been published or patented at some point.  You have most likely spoken at conferences.  You have leadership skills, but your primary focus is on doing. You spend the majority of your time building models that go into production and bring value at scale to end-users.  You hate red tape, yellow tape, or any tape for that matter and just want to be able to work unencumbered and deliver value.  If that is you, then Interos is where you should be.   Essential Functions/duties:   Serve as a key technical resource for machine learning engineers, helping them solve the most challenging problems.  Use machine learning, data mining, statistical techniques, and others to create actionable, meaningful, and scalable solutions for business problems.  Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of data and derive valuable insights.  Serve as a subject matter expert for natural language processing (NLP) and natural language understanding (NLU), and partner with functional experts across the company to bring that expertise to bear on some of the most complex and most exciting problems in this space.  Provide technical guidance to product teams on the choice of machine learning approaches appropriate for a task.  Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large-scale data analyses, model development, model validation, and model implementation.  Develop and enhance the predictive capability of in-house developed supply chain risk models for use by some of the biggest enterprises in the world.  Work with MLOps to deliver production systems with your models.   Qualifications:   MS in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or Applied Mathematics plus 12 years of hands-on experience in machine learning, predictive modeling, and analysis; or a PhD with 8 years experience.  10+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning, predictive modeling, and analysis.  Deep technical skills in machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing with the ability to explain and present deep technical ideas.  You currently hold an L6+ Staff/Principal/Fellow Machine Learning Engineer position.  A passion for creating innovative techniques and making these methods robust and scalable.  A long track record of productionizing ML models.  Creative, collaborative, & innovation-focused.  Fluency in Python and ML/NLP libraries.  Experience with transformer and recurrent language models BERT, GPT2, LSTM, Word2Vec.  Experience with databases and data structuring/warehousing.  Strong verbal and written communication skills, including interacting effectively with colleagues of varying technical and non-technical abilities.   Core Competencies:   Experience putting ML models into large high-availability production environments.  Contributions to open-source projects in the NLP/NLU space.  Good experience creating entity, relationship, and event extraction models.  Great sense of humor.  Positive, good-natured, and generally pleasant to be around.  Demonstrated commitment to building a diverse and inclusive culture.  A sense of adventure.   Additional Information:   Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no supervisory responsibilities.  Travel Requirements: This position does not require travel.  Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers.  Physical Demands: This is largely a sedentary role. Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 5 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment.  Colorado Only: The range provided is for Colorado-based hires only and will be commensurate with candidate experience. Pay ranges for candidates in other locations other than CO may differ based on the cost of labor in that location. Pay range: $224,250 - $282,000.  FLSA Status: Exempt   Vaccination Requirement:  Interos is required to comply with  Federal Executive Order 14042  mandating employees be vaccinated against COVID-19. All Interos employees must be fully vaccinated* against COVID-19, unless you have a legally valid medical or religious reason. Any requests for exemptions based on medical or sincerely held religious beliefs will be evaluated confidentially by our Chief People Officer after hiring.  Fully vaccinated means an individual must have received their second dose of the Moderna or Pfizer vaccine or the single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.  BENEFITS:   Comprehensive Health & Wellness package (Medical, Dental and Vision)  10 Paid Holiday Days Off  Flexible Paid Time Off (FTO)  Pet Insurance  401 (k) Employer Matching  Stock Options  Family Planning reimbursement  Legal Insurance  Identity Theft Protection  Child Tutoring Reimbursement  Career advancement opportunities  Casual Dress  On-site gym and dedicated Peloton room at headquarters  Company Events (Sports Games, Fitness Competitions, Birthday Celebrations, Contests, Happy Hours)  Annual company party  Employee Referral Program   Interos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other classification protected by law.  If you are a candidate in need of assistance or an accommodation in the application process, please contact HR@interos.ai

Maximus is seeking a Senior AI/ML Engineer to work with the Maximus Emerging Technologies Center of Excellence (CoE), a startup within a global organization. The mission is “Helping government serve the people.” We support our lines of business in transforming how governments serve the people and improve their lives, through the adoption of emerging technologies. In the role of a Senior AI/ML Engineer, you will collaborate with teams in advancing the applied use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML), support the end-to-end implementation of AI/ML solutions, work with engineering teams in integrating AI/ML solutions into their solutions, and investigate tools while supporting the deployment of MLOps platform. The CoE provides a unique opportunity in making a difference to citizens and society, while embracing an inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration in an environment that is committed to lifelong learning, growth, and development. As a federal contractor, Maximus is subject to Executive Order 14042 and the Safe Workforce Task Force’s COVID-19 Workplace Safety Guidance for Federal Contractors and Subcontractors. In light of these requirements, all employees will eventually need to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment and new hires/employees will be required to provide proof of vaccination. Primary Responsibilities:  Lead AI/ML solutions from scoping through deployment and monitoring Collaborate with engineers, solution architects, project managers, and our services teams, to design and implement models and experiments from end to end, including data ingestion and preparation, analysis and modeling, model deployment, monitoring and documentation Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines and builds AI/ML models to support our lines of business Contribute towards the curation, development and dissemination of AI/ML related educational materials Contribute towards the curation, development, and promotion of playbooks, best practices, standards such as Responsible AI, and lessons learned Support AI solutions from scoping through deployment and monitoring Collaborate on the selection and piloting of platforms (e.g. MLOps) and tools for the business Maintain current knowledge of AI technology landscape and emerging developments; attend tradeshows and conferences Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in related field 5-7 years of relevant professional experience required Minimum 3+ years leading end-to-end (scoping, design, development, testing, deployment, and monitoring) implementation of AI/ML solutions that drive significant business benefit Knowledge of design thinking, lean startup and agile project management practices Experience implementing solutions within cloud environments including container-based environments (Docker, Kubernetes) and MLOps platforms Experience with scientific and machine learning libraries e.g., SciPy, Scikit-learn, NumPy, spaCy, Spark NLP Experience with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow and PyTorch Strong software development skills Proficient in at least two programming languages including Python Proficient in building data processing pipelines Skilled in developing predictive models on structured data (regression, classification, clustering, time-series) Proficient with Natural Language Processing Experience with Knowledge Representation and GNN Additional preferred experience:  Helped develop AI communities through meetups, blogs etc. Knowledge graphs Bayesian networks Graph Neural Networks Experience with Reinforcement Learning Causal Modeling Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Work Location: One location

If you are looking for a rewarding career with a highly successful company that puts people first, Halvik Corp is the place for you! We are committed to delivering smarter IT-driven solutions bolstered by quality and innovation to help the US Federal Government succeed. Join our growing team and make a difference! Halvik is seeking Data Analysts to support our US Army (G4) contract. Responsibilities Provide analysis of programming data for the Program Objective Memorandum build, program reviews and Enterprise Business System Reviews. Contractor must have the knowledge of Army fiscal data elements, the purpose and relationship of the data elements to conduct the data analysis, manipulation of data for analysis and the capability to use Microsoft Office products to combine data, summarize and produce Excel products. This also includes the capability to pivot data, use basic formulas, transfer data tables, relate data tables based on common elements and develop presentations. Extract data from Army systems and provide analysis of data and formulating displays of data. The Army sources include: cPROBE/cSUSTAIN, Congressional Budget Justification Documents, Business system review data, and the APMS. Data analysis includes combining data from different systems, matching records and values using Microsoft Access and Excel, assessing funding profiles against historical funding profiles, current profiles and identifying RDTE and Procurement profiles that are not executable. Perform analysis to identify deltas at KEY5 level in cPROBE/ cSUSTAIN. This includes assessing the audits for new positions and identifying unplanned decrements and increases not submitted by the SS PEG in previous work sets and validation that work sets submitted were posted to PROBE. Provide draft taskers based on G-4 tasking guidance for SS PEG and the FYDP Review for approval by G-4 government lead. Assist with performing data integrity checks. This includes ensuring records are complete for fiscal code. Assist with quality control of Director, Quarterback, Champion, Chair, and Co-Chair Reviews. The contractor shall conduct quality control checks of Portfolio briefings and provide reports of analysis. The contractor shall attend all FYDP Review workbook kickoff meetings, document decisions/guidance and track thru the workbook process and provide independent analysis of issues to determine if issues is policy, process or data related.  Halvik offers a competitive full benefits package including: Company-supported medical, dental, vision, life, STD, and LTD insurance Benefits include 10 federal holidays and PTO. 401(k) with company matching Flexible Spending Accounts for commuter, medical, and dependent care expenses Tuition Assistance Charitable Contribution matching To comply with the guidance provided by the Safer Federal Workforce Task Force (Task Force) for Federal Contractors and Subcontractors, Halvik is requiring COVID-19 vaccinations for all their employees except where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation. Halvik Corp is an  equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job_Description: In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.  Work you'll do  Deloitte is looking for a Data Analytics Manager to lead the development of data management and the development of the processes and scripts required to transform and stage data necessary to develop products and conduct statistical analyses. Individuals are responsible for providing support to our clients to aid in their data management from ingestion through exploitation. The candidates may also be responsible for exploring and implementing new data enhancement tools and methodologies. The Data Specialist will work within database design, data management, data pipelining, and ETL practices.  The team  Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.  The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.  Qualifications  Required:  Bachelor's degree required Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future 10+ years experience in Data Engineering, Reporting, and/or Metadata management 3+ years experience with data governance tools (OvalEdge, Collibra, Talend, etc.) Expertise in health research, healthcare, bioinformatics and/or public health fields   Preferred:    Critical thinker who asks questions, digs-in, comes to new conclusions based on the findings Excellent communication skills: comfortable and experienced communicating to senior management and colleagues across functional areas Strong stakeholder management capabilities with key focus on delivery and client orientation   How you'll grow  At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

For further consideration please contact Andrew Lombardi - Andrew.Lombardi@KornFerry.com  Sentara Healthcare is seeking an innovative, entrepreneurial-minded leader with a deep technology background to lead the enterprise data team, governance, and strategy. This opportunity allows for a seasoned executive to join one of the premier health systems in the country. Directly reporting to Tim Skeen, Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer of Sentara Healthcare, the new Vice President, Chief Data Officer (“CDO”) will be a crucial change agent in the company’s strategy to leverage internal and external data assets to fuel data applications and advanced analytics. Data and the ability to perform advanced analytics using data are key to supporting the needed changes in the healthcare ecosystem.  This individual will: > Lead data strategy and governance. > Create and drive the enterprise data architecture and roadmap. > Assess and optimize Sentara’s Information Lifecycle. > Build an overarching data and tools ecosystem to support advanced analytics, and interoperability internally and externally. > Lead a 24x7x365 data and analytics operational environment and the teams involved in managing and operating the data infrastructure.  The CDO be a key asset and change agent in the company’s continued transformation towards a consumer health solutions organization by guiding, inspiring, and building a “best in class” data platform for the communities we serve. As a trusted advisor to the executive team, this individual will lead the development of the data strategy, roadmap, and execution, transforming provider, customer, patient, and member engagement through data, and the enablement of advanced analytics. This leader will oversee and optimize both data and analytic platforms that deliver valuable solutions for a range of end-users to ensure that business objectives are achieved more efficiently and effectively across Sentara’s health plan (Optima) and care delivery network. The Chief Data Officer will be a strong cross-functional leader who can liaise with other C-suite executives and work harmoniously with different business verticals to orchestrate a federated approach to data and analytic platforms. The selected person should have deep experience with aligning multiple stakeholders, generating enthusiasm and endorsement from leadership teams, and broadening our workforce understanding towards organizational change. She/he will be a motivating and respected leader across all levels of the organization and play an integral role in managing our best-in-class teams.  Key Responsibilities The Chief Data Officer will have a broad set of responsibilities, including: > Create and establish a strategy and vision that shapes and drives data and supports analytics to enable the company to function more efficiently. Identify growth opportunities, mitigate financial risk, identify business cost savings opportunities, and ensure that data can be appropriately accessed and consumed across the company. > Develop a scalable data architecture that supports the transformation of Sentara to a digital, analytically driven organization. This includes ensuring data is available for enterprise applications, digital consumer-facing applications, analytic applications, as well as for the clinical research and the community of analytic professionals that execute reporting, analytics, and advanced analytics for the enterprise. > Develop, drive, and execute the long-term vision and strategy for the data and platforms that enable advanced analytics by working with multiple teams and stakeholders across the company. Creates value by unlocking and sharing data, and information in ways which will spur innovation. > Partner with the VP, Enterprise Analytics to introduce automation, artificial intelligence, and predictive learning initiatives that drive the future of sustainable and quality healthcare delivery. Additionally, work to expand current data governance processes and establish a comprehensive data governance program. > Assume primary responsibility for driving core data governance processes including data standards, data quality, and metadata management that ensure the completeness, accuracy, consistency, validity & uniqueness of enterprise data, as well as the architecture and operational processes that ensure data is accessible, timely, and fit for use. Effectively manages risk associated with the use of data. Strive to reduce the cost of managing data and increase the value of the data. > Work with business and IT leaders to identify areas of technical needs for future data science capabilities. Drives the development and deployment of the data and advanced analytics platform. Identifies and manages the prioritization of business projects and enterprise data initiatives. > Develop a deep understanding of the lines of business Portfolio and Products’ needs and priorities and work closely with each business to identify solutions that align with the enterprise strategy, leveraging enterprise solutions, and when needed provides specific solutions that are unique for that business.  > Lead, manage, and partner with cross functional teams to continually improve data governance, data quality, and data security in a multi-tenant environment; standardize data quality measurements by establishing metrics, building tools, and processes. > Serve as an advisor and consultant to business leaders across the enterprise; has strong ability to influence, thought partnership(s), and collaborate with executive leaders, technology leaders, and partners, business stakeholders and their respective team(s). > Promote and lead a culture of operational excellence and continuous improvement for the daily support of data and analytics platforms and constantly evolve and transform based on the enterprise needs. > Develop, coach, and lead a high performing team, and manage a diverse team of professionals that focuses on maximizing performance, business impact and results, as well as career development and succession plan(s). > Maintain an understanding of new and emerging technology trends, and an awareness of innovative techniques and companies. > Collaborate with industry data experts to understand emergent approaches to data management and platform development in the support of digital platforms, analytic platforms, and research platforms. > Recommends and pursues collaborations and provides appropriate technical guidance to ensure the success of such collaborations.  Education Level An undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, MIS, or an appropriate discipline is required. An advanced degree in Information Systems or a related field is preferred.  Experience The Chief Data Officer will be a technology leader with at least 10 years of broadly based, progressive information management and data strategy experience, ideally within healthcare. Proven leadership and management skills are paramount, and the successful candidate must clearly demonstrate the ability to create, lead and execute a vision for an enterprise data function. The successful candidate must possess significant experience and expertise in modern, cloud-based platforms and tools, preferably Azure. One’s experience should also include leading an organization on the challenging journey from legacy, on-prem tools to modern cloud-enabled capabilities.  License None, unless noted in the "Other" section below  Skills Required:  Preferred: None, unless noted in the "Other" section below  Other   At least 10 years of progressively responsible relevant experience in data management, including creating partnerships, implementing data governance, and understanding the underlying technologies needed to enable data innovation across a midsized or large organization.  Demonstrated experience in building and managing technical platforms that support analytics, including platforms that support machine learning and AI driven approaches to predictive and prescriptive modeling.  Experience in computer programming, query languages, and data visualization platforms such as Tableau, and advanced analytic ecosystems that enable the productionalization and automation of AI & ML-driven predictive and prescriptive models preferred.  Demonstrated experience with developing data strategy, policies, and procedures, as well as successfully executing programs that meet or exceed expectations in a dynamic environment; experience creating tools and capabilities to assist with data discovery, and collaboration, ensure data quality, and to load, clean, enrich, manage, and share data and metadata from a variety of sources.  Ability to effectively drive business, culture, and technology change in a dynamic, and complex operating environment.  Ability to effectively coordinate, allocate, and manage resources and projects throughout multiple teams.  Knowledge of trends, and developments in the fields of data management and analytic platforms. Information management, and quantitative skills, including working knowledge of IT infrastructure, various technologies/platforms, and enterprise-specific vendor solutions.  Industry-specific knowledge of data security protocols, policies, and regulations. Exemplary diplomatic skills, and ability to help senior business leaders see value, opportunities, and risks beyond their own area of expertise.  Ability to understand problems from a broad perspective, and anticipate the impact of administrative issues, and solutions.  Proven experience as a thought leader and innovator in the development of new tools, methodologies, and problem-solving approaches; including but not limited to experience with cloud, big data and enabling machine learning and artificial intelligence.  Deep experience in data architecture, data governance, warehousing, quality processes, and implementation. Skilled in structuring fact and dimension tables, leading logical and physical database design, data modeling, reporting metadata and ETL processes.  Ability to balance strategic development and day-to-day operation responsibilities Superb track record of change management and driving change in a large, complex organization; strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated success in driving change and alignment on an organizational and interpersonal level; experience integrating teams across multiple business units.  Energized by the opportunity to work with Sentara’s leadership, reporting, and technology teams to drive institutional change in the way the organization engages with its providers, patients, and customers  An understanding of healthcare globally, underlying markets, and key market drivers, global megatrends including data governance in other industries, and the value of data in acting on external disruption and market trends  Software engineering expertise including experience with SAFE Agile Methodology and Portfolio Management.  Exceptional analytical, written, oral, and presentation skills with proven track record of effectively communicating actionable insights.  Excellent communication skills of an executive who excels in communicating in a variety of formal and informal presentation settings, large and small, both inside and outside the organization, and issuing cogent and consistent messages that build confidence and achieve desired outcomes  Excellent problem solving and negotiating skills.

Historically, the travel requirement for this position has ranged from 80-100%. The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities, and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. For now, all KPMG business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. At some point in the future and with the safety of people as the critical factor, the travel requirement will likely increase, possibly to previous levels, but KPMG is committed to balancing client requirements with new delivery capabilities. The KPMG Advisory practice is currently our fastest growing practice. We are seeing tremendous client demand, and looking forward we don't anticipate that slowing down. In this ever-changing market environment, our professionals must be adaptable and thrive in a collaborative, team-driven culture. At KPMG, our people are our number one priority. With a wealth of learning and career development opportunities, a world-class training facility and leading market tools, we make sure our people continue to grow both professionally and personally. If you're looking for a firm with a strong team connection where you can be your whole self, have an impact, advance your skills, deepen your experiences, and have the flexibility and access to constantly find new areas of inspiration and expand your capabilities, then consider a career in Advisory. KPMG is currently seeking an Senior Specialist in Federal Digital Lighthouse for our Federal Advisory practice. Responsibilities: Collaborate with multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams to translate business objectives into artificial intelligence approaches and objectives; Strong aptitude for quickly learning business operational, process, delivery and revenue models Work with clients and team leads to discover data sources, and create data requests; collaborate with data engineers to develop and utilize the ETL process to ingest and enrich structured and unstructured data Perform explanatory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns; Perform data analytics, develop complex dashboards and reproducible visualizations, machine learning and statistical analysis methods Rapidly learn and understand client business processes by reviewing technical documents, business catalogs, white papers and deep dive into KPMG's client data to better understand the relationship between datasets, client systems and data sources Contribute in developing dashboards, UI and interactive tools to support clients to turn their data into actionable insights and reproducible reports Qualifications: Minimum three years of technical data science experience; U.S. Federal government consulting experience Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university Experience in statistics and machine learning Experience with coding languages such as Statistical Analysis System (SAS), R, or Python Experience with databases such as MySQL, Postgres, Haddop, and Mongo DB Experience with data visualization and reporting technologies Experience with Hadoop and MapReduce Ability to obtain a U.S. Federal government security clearance within a reasonable period of time, which requires U.S. citizenship KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. Description  Job Description: Are you ready to join Leidos all-star team? Through training, teamwork, and exposure to challenging technical work, let Leidos show how to accelerate your career path. The Leidos Innovation Center (LInC) Advanced Analytics team has an opening for a Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher Scientist with a background that reflects designing, implementing, and analyzing approaches that integrate, adapt, and extend novel capabilities to state-of-the-art technical challenges in competitive contract research and development (R&D) programs (basic and applied). Candidates with a background in computational linguistics, human language technology, machine translation, automated speech recognition, machine translation, linguistic data analysis, statistical programming, data science, and technical writing, and experience participating in and leading multi-disciplinary teams of researchers and engineers are strongly preferred. Work is located in Arlington, VA. We are looking for a research scientist with a specialization in NLP research to work as part of multi-disciplinary team to develop and implement approaches and solutions for contract research and development projects. The innovative technical approaches and solutions delivered to customers advance the state of the art in the research while addressing long-term problems of importance to national security. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience implementing and adapting range of state of the art technologies in the area of natural language processing. Fun challenges you will get to work on:  Working at the direction of a technical lead (e.g., PhD-level research scientist), the candidate will work independently on research programs and adapt NLP technologies as part of a large project addressing highly-complex research challenges. Collect, develop, and data sets based common to machine learning-based NLP tasks. Examples include data collection, exploration, formatting; dimension reduction; enhancing and improving data quality; and feature selection and engineering. Adapt and extend state of the art machine learning-based technologies to support NLP tasks. To be successful in this role you need these skills (required):  Bachelor's degree in computational linguistics, computer science, data science, or a related discipline, such as statistics or applied mathematics with 2 years of specialized experience innovating analytical techniques and performing analytical functions using machine-learning libraries or other approaches. Experience with a subfield of NLP such as computational linguistics, human language technologies, automatic speech recognition, machine translation Experience in the following areas: text processing and construction of corpora in unfamiliar languages; processing of large text collections with standard NLP tools for parsing, entity extraction, POS tagging, topic discovery and classification (such as sentiment analysis), and natural language understanding; tuning hyper-parameters of existing NLP models for domain-specific data sets; computational manipulation and analysis of natural language documents using statistical models; experimenting with large corpora for developing and testing advanced NLP algorithms. Ability to program in Python, Perl, or other scripting language; comfort with work in a Linux environment. Familiarity with common NLP and ML toolkits such as Stanford CoreNLP, OpenNLP, NLTK, scikit-learn, and Tensorflow. Knowledge of state-of-the-art methods coupled with the creativity and intelligence to advance beyond them. Track record of active learning and creative problem solving. Experience contributing to technical projects to successful completion. Avanade is seeking the next Global Data & AI CoE Lead … could it be you? Avanade is seeking an experienced, passionate, and driven Global Data & AI Center of Excellence Lead to join our Global Solution Area (GSA) organization. The successful candidate will manage, build, and lead a team of professionals to enable Avanade to achieve accelerated growth across the Regions by driving client impact, showcasing technical leadership & advancing our offerings across Microsoft Data Platform Modernization, AI & IoT and Intelligent Automation (including Power Platform services). The successful candidate should have long-term experience helping clients amplify their existing data and analytic platforms by implementing state-of-the-art, best-in-breed data platform, IoT architectures, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning models.  The areas of influence for our Data & AI CoE include:  Driving Client Impact:  Increasing win rates through presales, including competitive positioning, and solutioning support on key deals. Delivering through shared best practices, harvesting innovation, incubating new Offerings, implementing methodology, and providing quality assurance across region and areas.  Showcasing Technical Leadership:  Demonstrating Avanade’s technical leadership in the market (e.g., speaking, conferences, webcasts, blogging). Helping regions transition from sales to delivery and jump-starting projects. When large, complex projects arise, our Data & AI COE members will play a delivery subject matter expert role. Fostering the technical skills required to be recognized in the market; supporting the Regions to develop these skills.  Advancing our Offerings:  Collaborating with key stakeholders across our business units and offerings to evolve points-of-view (POVs), whitepapers, assets, and differentiators to assist in winning and delivering successful projects. Tracking the best client sales and delivery stories. As the Data & AI CoE Lead aligned to our Data & AI Practice, you will leverage your business, leadership, creativity, and technology acumen to influence Avanade’s Data & AI practice and lead across our data platform, AI, IoT and automation capabilities in the CoE to achieve our growth targets. You will be a pivotal member of the GSA team and key to the success of Avanade’s innovative Data & AI Center of Excellence. The successful candidate should be open-minded in bringing and learning from best practices, being a thought leader as well as experienced practitioner and business lead.  About You: You have expertise in selecting optimal architectures and delivery approaches that will service clients’ needs with a balance of costs, capability, and risks to achieve business outcomes. You have experience in developing client roadmaps, program building, incorporating intelligent processes into existing business process, and solution planning. You have a deep understanding of the Data &AI space (Azure preferred) and, more importantly, you know how to connect with clients and lead a global team to its goals. You are curious about digital disruption and innovation, you are organized, energetic and as comfortable in front of a board room as before a white board with your development team. You like both branches of the business, the sales/presales and the customer/delivery. You have experience working within a highly matrixed, geographically dispersed professional services organization where you have applied business technology leadership, consulting and project-based leadership with a passion for driving positive business outcomes. You have demonstrated people leadership, "leading by influence" and effective peer teaming expertise. You have experience assessing and managing opportunities and risks associated with managing a business. Architecture expertise: Provide high-level architectural expertise to sales, project, and other analytics teams   Leadership & Team Management Responsibilities:   Resource & skills planning: Monitor growth and delivery performance along with forecast to identify resource and skill needs to deliver solutions for clients  Strategic vision & roadmap: Develop overall solution plans and strategic vision for Data & AI solutions, providing a comprehensive roadmap for clients’ needs  Asset development & prioritization: Develop and drive offering dev prioritization while being adaptable as new opportunities arise  Team inclusion & diversity: Ensure an inclusive and diverse approach is embedded into how the team is managed and run  People management: Support the greater people ecosystem, including but not limited to recruiting, performance reviews, compensation, and rewards  Client leadership & support: Demonstrate personal client leadership to help build client relationships and deliver business value  Driving team utilization: Enabling and supporting client impact and value across the globe through the Data & AI CoE team while helping to meet a team market utilization goal   Key Skills & Capabilities:   Excellent client management skills  Be known for your "client centric" approach and delivery excellence  Proven client experience selecting architecture that services clients’ needs with the balance of costs, capability, and risk to meet clients’ business objectives  Demonstrated experience of turning business use case and requirements to technical solutions  Strong understanding of the value proposition(s) associated with AI, Data, PaaS (Azure preferred), and DevOps  Demonstrated ability to work in roles with growing responsibility within professional services/management consulting or technology firms.  Experience successfully solutioning Data & AI programs and system integration projects across multiple work streams and geographically dispersed teams  Experience designing and solutioning Data platform/AI & IoT or automation deals (depending on area of deeper expertise)  Experience partnering on transformation sales pursuits  Some experience of one or more industries is welcome and an eagerness to learn more is preferred.  High degree of integrity, judgement, discretion, credibility, resilience, confidence, and character  Excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders   Preferred Education Background: You possess a Bachelor’s degree and/or Masters in a field such as Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics or have an equivalent combination of education and experience.  Preferred Years of Work Experience: You likely have about 8-10+ years of applied experience solutioning programs and system integration projects that include Modern Data Platform and Advanced Analytics, preferably in a business consulting (technology focus) environment or a combination of experience and relevant education. When you join Verizon  Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here. What you’ll be doing...  Verizon New Business Incubation (NBI) is looking for a Chief Applied Scientist to help us develop and deliver cutting edge automation technologies to our customers via our industry leading 5G network. Reporting directly to the CTO of NBI, you will lead the development of our machine learning and artificial intelligence capabilities designed to advance a variety of initiatives - from mobile robot autonomy and Edge AI, to cybersecurity. We are looking for a technical innovator with strong product instincts and a collaborative, empathetic approach to their work. You will have an intimate understanding of reinforcement learning, self-supervised learning, synthetic data generation, and be comfortable working with the CTO to execute a business-oriented technology strategy that drives customer satisfaction and enables exponential revenue growth. Work with technical and business leadership to gain a detailed understanding of our target markets, key revenue opportunities, and upcoming products. Work with our customers to gain an extremely detailed understanding of their standard operating procedures and business processes. Leverage the above understanding to design automation strategies, developing and training the AI/ML capabilities necessary to insert autonomous and stationary robots into existing workflows. Provide technical leadership of R&D projects, working with R&D engineers to define, capture, and execute development programs that generate novel, state-of-the-art algorithms and solutions for applied use cases. Hire, grow, and manage a team of applied scientists, guiding their customer-centric work and methods with an eye on cross-utilization between customers, industries, and problem sets. What we’re looking for...  Our Chief Applied Scientist should have a strong background in the area of mathematics-based machine learning. Candidates are expected to come with demonstrated capabilities on probabilistic methods, including, but not limited to, non-parametric Bayesian networks, convolutional neural networks, compact probabilistic representation, multimodal deep belief networks, detection, autonomous heterogeneous sensor networks, and reinforcement transfer and one-shot learning methods. You'll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Even better if you have one or more of the following: MS (PhD preferred) with six or more years of multidisciplinary professional research experience. Specialization in deep supervised and/or deep reinforcement learning. Experience as the technical, hands-on principal investigator for mathematics-based machine learning R&D programs. Experience as the technical lead on new business acquisition initiatives. Strong technical writing and verbal presentation skills. Established track record of developing a technical research strategy that drives AI/ML development for R&D groups. A relationship-driven workstyle with a dedication to interdisciplinary collaboration and strong commitment to mentoring less senior staff and colleagues. Publication in refereed technical journals. Five or more years of experience working with Edge AI, reinforcement, active, and supervised learning, as applied to both stationary and autonomous robots. Five or more years of experience working with IoT and computer vision platforms, with expertise designing, training, and deploying novel deep learning architectures and a broad understanding of DL methods and literature. Strong development experience in languages like C++ and Python, as well as frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch, Kuda, and/or Keras. Understanding of the limitations of algorithms and data, with a creative approach for overcoming those limitations to close gaps and solve problems. Our growing program works with the most forward leaning technologies and extraordinary customers who are thought and action leaders in within the AI/ML domain. We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package to the right person for this key position.  ECS is seeking an Data Applied Technology Analyst (ATA) to work in our Fairfax, VA office. This position is responsible for collaboratively supporting a project team which is responsible for managing an Artificial Intelligence initiative. This position is primarily responsible for supporting a DoD entity focusing on data collection and autonomous aircraft project which includes remotely sensed data, computer vision enabled features, very large datasets, and cloud solutions.  Position Responsibilities:   Internal and external project and client reporting.  Formal meeting minutes recordation and dissemination.  Working with large datasets and performing data ETL, analysis and reporting.  Requirements gathering and documentation, peer-reviewing deliverables.  Daily operational support to technical and program leadership.  Candidates must be able to use critical thinking to pinpoint key details and communicate effectively.  Responsible for assisting the Project Technical Lead, technical teams, and partner agencies/companies with limited oversight.   Telework/Remote: Telework is allowed Travel: 10% travel will be required, CONUS and OCONUS  Required Skills:   Must be a US Citizen.  Must possess an Active Secret Clearance; ability to obtain a Top-Secret Clearance with SCI preferred.  Current or pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Data Science, Math, Finance, Statistics, Information Management, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or an equivalent field.  A strong background in computer technology is necessary, including knowledge of data science, programming languages, and MS Office products.  1-2 years of programming experience, preference for python.  Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and professionally while demonstrating technical expertise (fluency in English is required).  Autonomous self-starter with a passion for analytics and problem solving.  Strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking ability.  Ability to effectively communicate ideas to and interact with customers, management, and peers with varying levels of technical expertise.  Experience working with multiple stakeholders in the customer space and managing competing priorities.   Desired Skills:   Top-Secret Clearance with SCI preferred.  Experience with programming and/or scripting: Python, R, SQL.  Experience with Linux.  Experience working with cloud technologies (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, etc.).  Experience with data engineering, structure, formatting, conditioning, and analysis.  Experience with database tools and current data science processes.  An interest in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.  Experience with version control tools, such as GitHub and Git. job_title: Data Scientist– AI/ Machine Learning Engineer
job_Description: Critical Mission Solutions   Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.  We're invested in you and your success. Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed –today and into tomorrow. Red Arch Solutions (RAS) is building robust CDF Data Warehouse solution that supports all-source data analysis and advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) that can be leveraged by all branches of military service, combat support agencies (CSAs) and Combatant Commands (CCMDs).  The CDF Data Warehouse will help the warfighter make informed decisions by supporting advanced AI/ML on all available data resources to provide advanced analytics capabilities. As a baseline, the CDF Data Warehouse will provide warehouse functions to the CDF Data Broker Platform . RAS will design, prototype, operationalize, and maintain the CDF Data Warehouse using the data provided by the CDF Data Broker Platform. The warehouse will be designed with the intent to franchise the solution, allowing other agencies and missions to benefit and for the data supply to grow as it is integrated with other systems. For this program we need a Data Scientist who will Interface with the user agencies. Performs conceptual and logical modeling of the data. Supports the definition of the data input & outputs Qualifications: Associates Degree + 10 years, Bachelors Degree + 8 years or Master Degree + 6 years of experience Experience working with users to help define their database use, data analytics, and the data user experience.
